fields.explanation: An irrigation project is categorized as a major project if it covers a cultivable command area of above 10,000 hectares.

fields.question: The programme of ‘Operation Flood’ was concentrated on
fields.explanation: Operation Flood in India, a project of the National Dairy Development Board (NDDB), was the world's biggest dairy development program which made India, a milk-deficient nation, the largest milk producer in the world, surpassing the USA in 1998.

fields.question: According to Ferrel’s law (Coriolis Force) winds change their direction
fields.option1: Towards left in Northern hemisphere and towards right in Southern hemisphere
fields.option2: Towards right in Northern hemisphere and towards left in Southern hemisphere
fields.option3: Towards right in both the hemisphere
fields.option4: Towards left in both the hemisphere
fields.answer: Towards right in Northern hemisphere and towards left in Southern hemisphere
fields.explanation: The law explains that wind is deflected to the right in the Northern Hemisphere and to the left in the Southern Hemisphere, derived from the application of the Coriolis effect to air masses.

fields.question: Which one of the following atmospheric layers absorb ultraviolet rays of the sun?
fields.explanation: The ozone layer, also called ozonosphere, is a region of the upper atmosphere, between roughly 15 and 35 km (9 and 22 miles) above Earth's surface, containing relatively high concentrations of ozone molecules (O3).

fields.question: The drainage pattern developed on folded sedimentary rock is termed as
fields.explanation: A dendritic drainage pattern refers to the pattern formed by the streams, rivers, and lakes in a particular drainage basin. It usually looks like the branching pattern of tree roots and it mainly develops in regions underlain by homogeneous material.

fields.question: Which one of the following is not a line of demarcation between two countries?
fields.explanation: The Plimsoll line is not a line of demarcation between two countries.

fields.question: Water potential remains lowest in
fields.explanation: A halophyte is a plant that grows in waters of high salinity, coming into contact with saline water through its roots or by salt spray, such as in saline semi-deserts, mangrove swamps, marshes and sloughs, and seashores.

fields.question: The free living bacterium in the soil which increases the yield of rice is
fields.explanation: Azotobacter is a genus of usually motile, oval or spherical bacteria that form thick-walled cysts and may produce large quantities of capsular slime.

fields.question: Frontal cyclones occur characteristically in
fields.explanation: Extratropical cyclones, sometimes called mid-latitude cyclones or wave cyclones, are a group of cyclones defined as synoptic scale low pressure weather systems that occur in the middle latitudes of the Earth (outside the tropics) not having tropical characteristics.

fields.question: "Yosemite" is a
fields.explanation: Yosemite is a famous waterfall located in Yosemite National Park in the Sierra Nevada of California.

fields.question: Where is the shore based steel plant located?
fields.explanation: The Visakhapatnam Steel Plant, also known as Vizag Steel, is a shore-based steel plant located in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh.

fields.question: Which two of the following are connected by the North South corridor?
fields.explanation: The North-South Corridor is a part of the Golden Quadrilateral project, connecting Srinagar in the north and Kanyakumari in the south.

fields.question: Which of the following statements is correct?
fields.option1: Mahadeo hills are in the west of Maikala hills
fields.option2: Mahadeo hills are the part of Karnataka Plateau
fields.option3: Mahadeo hills are in the east of Chhotanagpur Plateau
fields.option4: Mahadeo hills are the part of Aravalli ranges
fields.answer: Mahadeo hills are in the west of Maikala hills
fields.explanation: The Mahadeo Hills are a range of hills in Madhya Pradesh state of central India. The hills form the central part of the Satpura Range and are in the west of the Maikala Hills.

fields.question: Which one of the following pairs is not correctly matched?
fields.explanation: Dekke Toba fish is found in Indonesia. Lake Toba (Indonesian: Danau Toba) is a lake and supervolcano in Indonesia.

fields.question: Which of the following resources is renewable one?
fields.explanation: Timber, obtained from plants, is considered renewable because after cutting a tree, another can be planted to grow and provide more wood.

fields.question: Soil erosion can be prevented by
fields.explanation: Afforestation helps prevent soil erosion by stabilizing the soil with plant roots, which bind the soil and prevent it from being washed away.

fields.question: Natural sources of air pollution are
fields.explanation: A dust storm or sand storm is a meteorological phenomenon common in arid and semi-arid regions, where strong winds blow loose sand and dirt from a dry surface.

fields.question: The 'graded profile' of a river course is a
fields.option1: smooth curve in the upper course
fields.option2: smooth curve in the middle course
fields.option3: smooth curve in the lower course
fields.option4: smooth curve from source to mouth
fields.answer: smooth curve from source to mouth
fields.explanation: A river profile is a curve that shows the slope of a river from source to mouth. It smooths out irregularities to form a graded profile.

fields.question: Sink hole is a phenomenon of _______ topography.
fields.explanation: Karst is a landscape formed from the dissolution of soluble rocks, such as limestone, dolomite, and gypsum. It is characterized by sinkholes, caves, and underground drainage systems.

fields.question: The longest continental Railway in the world is
fields.explanation: The Trans-Siberian Railway is the longest railway line in the world. It has a length of 9,289 km which connects Moscow to Vladivostok.

fields.question: Which of the following is FALSE with respect to rain water harvesting? (SSC CGL 2015)
fields.option2: It helps meet rising water demand
fields.option4: It is a device of water conservation
fields.explanation: One of the Major objectives and advantages of rainwater harvesting is to reduce run off loss.

fields.question: Which of the following river does not originate in Indian territory?
fields.explanation: Brahmaputra River is one of the largest rivers in the world. The origin of Brahmaputra River is in southwestern Tibet as the Yarlung River.

fields.question: Which one among the following industries is the maximum consumer of water in India?
fields.explanation: Thermal Power Plants consume the maximum industrial water in India.

fields.question: Choose the correct option which represents the arrangement of atmospheric layers.
fields.explanation: The current sequence is Troposphere-Stratosphere-Mesosphere-Ionosphere-Exosphere.

fields.question: Which of the following options correctly explains the term ‘heat budget’?
fields.option1: It is the amount of heat which the surface of earth receives from the sun.
fields.option2: It is the radiation from the earth in the form of long waves
fields.option3: It is a mode of transfer of heat through matter by molecular activity.
fields.option4: It is the balance between incoming and outgoing radiation.
fields.answer: It is the balance between incoming and outgoing radiation.
fields.explanation: The Earth and the atmosphere are heated by energy from the sun. The atmospheric heat budget of the Earth depends on the balance between insolation and outgoing terrestrial radiation.

fields.question: The layer of atmosphere close to the earth's surface is called:
fields.explanation: The troposphere is the first layer above the surface and contains half of the Earth's atmosphere. Weather occurs in this layer. This is closest to the Earth's surface, extending up to about 10-15 km above the Earth's surface.

fields.question: Which of the following plant shows chloroplast dimorphism?
fields.explanation: Sugarcane shows chloroplast dimorphism. The presence of bundle sheath with chloroplast in the leaves is granulated and lacking in starch. Such feature is known as chloroplast dimorphism.

fields.question: Day and Night are equal at the:
fields.explanation: The equator receives equal day and night throughout the year because it does not tilt in relation to the sun's location. Because of the tilted axis of the Earth, the poles and locations away from the equator lean towards or away from the sun as an orbit is completed, while the equator stays in essentially the same location relative to the sun.

fields.question: Evergreen type forests are found in: (SSC CGL 2015)
fields.explanation: The tropical rainforest is earth's most complex biome in terms of both structure and species diversity. It occurs under optimal growing conditions, abundant precipitation and year round warmth. Mean monthly temperatures are above 64°F; precipitation is often in excess of 100 inches a year. There is usually a brief season of reduced precipitation. In monsoonal areas, there is a real dry season but that is more than compensated for with abundant precipitation the rest of the year.

fields.question: The ash-grey soils of high latitude coniferous forests are known as:
fields.explanation: Podsol soil is a soil that develops in temperate to cold moist climates under coniferous or heath vegetation; an organic mat over a grey leached layer.

fields.question: Equinox occurs when the sun is vertically above
fields.explanation: The sun is vertically above the equator during an equinox, resulting in equal day and night durations.

fields.question: Among the world oceans, which ocean is having the widest continental shelf?
fields.explanation: The largest shelf - the Siberian Shelf in the Arctic Ocean - stretches to 1,500 kilometers (930 mi) in width. The South China Sea lies over another extensive area of continental shelf, the Sunda Shelf, which joins Borneo, Sumatra, and Java to the Asian mainland.

fields.question: Which is the largest peninsular river in India? (SSC CGL 1st Sit. 2016)
fields.explanation: In terms of length, catchment area, and discharge, the Godavari river is the largest in peninsular India and had been dubbed as the 'Dakshina Ganga' - the South Ganges river.

fields.question: Red soil is normally found in India in which regions?
fields.option3: Eastern & Southern part of the Deccan Plateau
fields.answer: Eastern & Southern part of the Deccan Plateau

fields.question: Limestone is a raw material used by which industry?
Mount Abu is a hill station located in _____ ranges.
The only perennial river in Peninsular India is _____ .
When does solar eclipse take place?
fields.option1: When the sun is between the moon and earth
fields.option2: When the earth is between the moon and sun
fields.option3: When the moon is between the sun and earth
fields.option4: When the moon does not lie on the line joining the sun and earth
fields.answer: When the moon is between the sun and earth
fields.explanation: A solar eclipse occurs when the Moon passes between Earth and the Sun, thereby totally or partly obscuring the image of the Sun for a viewer on Earth.

fields.question: Strait of Gibraltar connects which of the following?
fields.explanation: Approximately 9 miles (14 km) wide at its narrowest point, the Strait of Gibraltar is the entry point into the Mediterranean Sea from the Atlantic Ocean. It is bordered by the continents of Africa and Europe, and the countries of Morocco, Spain, the British colony of Gibraltar, and the Spanish exclave of Ceuta.

fields.question: The largest solar power plant in India is located at
On which river is the Tehri dam built?
fields.explanation: Tehri Dam is a multi-purpose rock and earth-fill embankment dam on the Bhagirathi River near Tehri in Uttarakhand, India.

fields.question: With which country, India has the longest international boundary?
fields.explanation: India has 15,106.7 km of land border and a coastline of 7,516.6 km including island territories. The length of our land borders with neighbouring countries is as follows: Bangladesh: 4,096.7 China: 3,488 Pakistan: 3,323 Nepal: 1,751 Myanmar: 1,643 Bhutan: 699 Afghanistan: 106.

fields.question: Which State in India has the largest coastline?
fields.explanation: Gujarat is strategically located with the largest share in India’s coastline, followed by Andhra Pradesh and Tamil Nadu.

fields.question: Jog falls in Karnataka is located over which river?
fields.explanation: Jog Fall located at southern state of Karnataka is India’s highest waterfall. Its height is 830 feet and is located on Sharavati River.

fields.question: Which one of the following areas of India is covered by tropical evergreen forest?
Which of the following State is surrounded by Bangladesh from three sides?
fields.explanation: Tripura is surrounded by Bangladesh on its north, south, and west.

fields.question: Earth received heat from the sun is known as:
fields.explanation: Insolation refers to the amount of solar radiation received by a region of the Earth's surface.

fields.question: Spot the odd item in the following:
fields.explanation: The Red Sea is the odd item as it is not a landlocked sea, unlike the Black Sea, Caspian Sea, and Dead Sea.

fields.question: Match correctly the following, deserts and their location by choosing the correct response:
fields.explanation: Kalahari desert is present in Africa while Atacama Desert is in South America. Thar Desert is in Asia and Great Victoria is in Australia.

fields.question: The longest river of peninsular India is
fields.explanation: Godavari is the longest river of peninsular India. From its source to the Eastern Ghats, the Godavari River flows through gentle, somewhat monotonous terrain, along the way receiving the Darna, Purna, Manjra, Pranhita, and Indravati rivers. Upon entering the Eastern Ghats region, however, the river flows between steep and precipitous banks, its width contracting until it flows through a deep cleft only 600 feet (180 metres) wide, known as the Gorge.

fields.question: The Himalayan mountain range is an example of
fields.explanation: The Himalayan Mountain Range is an example of fold mountain. They are known as fold mountains because the mountains extend for 2500 km in length in a series of parallel ridges or folds and consist of three folds namely Himadri, Himachal, Shiwalik.

fields.question: Which one of the following is a warm ocean current?
fields.explanation: Gulf Stream is a warm ocean current. It flows along North America and drifts towards Western Europe, thus raising the temperature of the western coast considerably.

fields.question: The main advantage of Rain Water Harvesting (RWH) is
fields.explanation: Recharging of ground water is the main advantage of rain water harvesting. Rainwater harvesting provides an independent water supply during regional water restrictions and in developed countries is often used to supplement the main supply. It provides water when there is a drought, can help mitigate flooding of low-lying areas, and reduces demand on wells which may enable ground water levels to be sustained.

fields.question: India is the largest producer and exporter of
fields.explanation: India is the largest producer and exporter of tea. The Indian tea industry has grown to own many global tea brands and has evolved into one of the most technologically equipped tea industries in the world. Tea production, certification, exportation, and all other facts of the tea trade in India is controlled by the Tea Board of India.

fields.question: The soils which are rich in Calcium are known as
fields.explanation: Pedocal is a subdivision of the zonal soil order. It is a class of soil which forms in semiarid and arid regions. It is rich in calcium carbonate and has low soil organic matter.

fields.question: Cultivable land is defined as
fields.option3: Old fallow lands + current fallow lands
fields.option4: Total fallow lands + net sown area
fields.answer: Total fallow lands + net sown area
fields.explanation: Land able to be used for farming is called "cultivable land". It includes total fallow land and net sown area.

fields.question: Which of the following is the largest Biosphere Reserves of India?
fields.explanation: Gulf of Mannar with an area of 10500 sq.km. is the largest biosphere reserve of India.

fields.question: With what bio-region is the term 'Steppe' associated?
fields.explanation: In physical geography, a steppe is an ecoregion, characterized by grassland plains without trees apart from those near rivers and lakes.

fields.question: About how much of the world's land area is tropical rainforest?
fields.explanation: Covering around 2 percent of the Earth's total surface area, the world's tropical rainforests are home to 50 percent of the Earth's plants and animals. Rainforests can be found all over the world from as far north as Alaska and Canada to Latin America, Asia, and Africa.

fields.question: The world's growing appetite for what food product is a leading cause of tropical deforestation?
fields.explanation: The world's growing appetite for beef is a leading cause of tropical deforestation.

fields.question: What is Kyoto Protocol?
fields.option1: It is an agreement among countries to take steps for planting trees to control pollution
fields.option2: It is an agreement among countries to start using nuclear energy
fields.option3: It is an agreement among countries to take steps for reducing global warming
fields.option4: It is an agreement among countries to take steps for reducing acid rain.
fields.answer: It is an agreement among countries to take steps for reducing global warming
fields.explanation: Kyoto Protocol is an international treaty among countries to reduce greenhouse gases emissions based on the premise that (i) global warming exists and (ii) man-made CO2 emissions.

fields.question: The largest reservoir of fresh water is:
fields.explanation: Glacial ice or Glaciers are the largest reservoir of freshwater on Earth.

fields.question: The most abundant element by number in the living system is:
How much of world's surface is covered by water?
fields.explanation: About 70 percent of the Earth’s surface is water-covered and the oceans hold about 96.5 percent of all Earth’s water.

fields.question: Which of the following Scientist proved that the path of each planet around the Sun is elliptical?
fields.explanation: Johannes Kepler was a German mathematician, astronomer and astrologer. He is best known for his laws of planetary motion which stated that the orbit of a planet is an ellipse with the Sun at one of the two foci.

fields.question: Which of the following rivers originates from Trans Himalayas?
fields.explanation: The Trans-Himalayan rivers originate beyond the great Himalayas. The name of the rivers are the Indus, the Sutlej and the Brahmaputra river.

fields.question: The most suitable soil for the production of cotton is?
fields.explanation: Black soil or Black Lava Soil is considered most suitable for sowing cotton crops.

fields.question: The largest producer of Lignite in India is:
fields.explanation: Neyveli lignite field in Tamil Nadu is the largest lignite coal mine in India.

fields.question: Sex–ratio is calculated as:
fields.option1: No of females per 1,000 males in a Country
fields.option2: No of males per 1,000 females in a Country
fields.option3: No. of children per 1,000 people in a Country.
fields.option4: No of people per 1,000 children in a Country.
fields.answer: No of females per 1,000 males in a Country
fields.explanation: Sex ratio is used to describe the number of females per 1000 males in a country. In the Population Census of 2011 it was revealed that the population ratio in India 2011 is 940 females per 1000 of males.

fields.question: Which state of India has made rain water harvesting compulsory for all houses?
fields.explanation: In Tamil Nadu, rain water harvesting was made compulsory for every building to avoid ground water depletion.

fields.question: The five key indicators of global climate change of our planet are :
fields.option1: Sea–level, Rising temperatures, Rainfall, Nitrogen and Actic Sea ice
fields.option3: Arctic sea ice, carbon dioxide, Global temperature, Sea level and land ice
fields.option4: Antarctic sea ice, Oxygen, Rainfall, Drought and Sea level
fields.answer: Arctic sea ice, carbon dioxide, Global temperature, Sea level and land ice
fields.explanation: NASA has developed a series of interactive maps and graphs to describe the global climate and how it changes over time. The focus of 5 key climate indications include Arctic sea ice, carbon dioxide concentration, Global surface temperature, Sea level and land ice.

fields.question: The area reserved for the welfare of wild life is called
fields.explanation: The area reserved for the welfare of wildlife is designated as a National Park.

fields.question: The National Green Tribunal deals with cases relating to ?
fields.option2: Issues relating to protection and conservation of historical monuments.
fields.option4: Environmental protection and conservation of forests.
fields.answer: Environmental protection and conservation of forests.
fields.explanation: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) deals with cases relating to environmental protection and conservation of forests and other natural resources.

fields.question: The biggest oil spill in world history took place in the ?
fields.explanation: The biggest oil spill in world history took place in the Persian Gulf, near Kuwait, on 19th January 1991.

fields.question: Among the following which country has the highest life expectancy ?
fields.explanation: Japan has the highest life expectancy among the listed countries.

fields.question: The redness in atmosphere at Sunrise and Sunset is due to:
fields.explanation: The redness observed in the atmosphere at Sunrise and Sunset is due to scattering of light.

fields.question: Which one of the following tribes practices pastoral nomadism ?

fields.question: Select the High Yielding Varieties of seed-crops developed under Green Revolution in India.
fields.option1: Wheat, Rice, Sugarcane, Pulses and Maize.
fields.option2: Rice, Wheat, Pulses, Oil seeds and Sugarcane
fields.option3: Maize, Black-gram, Jowar, Coffee and Tea.
fields.option4: Rice, Wheat, Jowar, Bajra and Maize.
fields.answer: Rice, Wheat, Jowar, Bajra and Maize.
fields.explanation: High Yielding Variety (HYV) seeds such as Rice, Wheat, Jowar, Bajra, and Maize played a vital role in the Green Revolution in India.

fields.question: India is the largest producer and consumer of
fields.explanation: India is the largest producer and consumer of tea.

fields.question: The busiest rail section in respect to goods transportation is
fields.explanation: The Delhi – Kolkata rail section is the busiest in terms of goods transportation.

fields.question: The Tropic of Cancer does not pass through
fields.explanation: The Tropic of Cancer does not pass through Nepal.

fields.question: The country in East Asia which is most conspicuous for its decreasing population growth since 1981 is

fields.question: Consider the following sea-ports: 1. Chennai 2. Machilipatnam 3. Nagapattinam 4. Tuticorin The correct sequence of these ports from north to south is
fields.explanation: From north to south, the correct sequence of sea-ports is: Machilipatnam (2), Chennai (1), Nagapattinam (3), Tuticorin (4).

fields.explanation: Santa Cruz is a domestic airport located in Mumbai.

fields.explanation: Petrology is the branch of geology that studies the origin, composition, distribution and structure of rocks.

fields.question: Match the following : A. Rosewood 1. Mangrove forests B. Bushes 2. Alpine forests C. Birch 3. Deciduous forests D. Sundari tree 4. Dry forests
fields.explanation: Rosewood matches with Dry forests, Bushes with Alpine forests, Birch with Deciduous forests, and Sundari tree with Mangrove forests.

fields.question: During the period of South-West monsoon, Tamil Nadu remains dry because :
fields.option1: the winds do not reach this area
fields.option2: there are no mountains in this area
fields.option3: it lies in the rain-shadow area
fields.option4: the temperature is too high to let the winds cool down
fields.answer: it lies in the rain-shadow area
fields.explanation: Tamil Nadu remains dry during the South-West monsoon due to its location in the rain-shadow area of the Arabian Sea current and parallel to the Bay of Bengal current.

fields.question: Which one of the following is not a line of demarcation between two countries?
fields.explanation: The International Date Line is not a line of demarcation between two countries; it marks the change in calendar date.

fields.question: Which state in India occupies the same ranking position in respect of area and population?
fields.explanation: Meghalaya ranks 23rd both in terms of area and population among Indian states.

fields.question: Lake formed in a cut off river meander is called:
fields.explanation: An Ox-Bow Lake is formed in a cut off river meander.

fields.question: Which is the leading state in India in 'Ship Breaking' industry?
fields.explanation: Gujarat is the leading state in India in the Ship Breaking industry, with Alang being a major ship breaking center.

fields.question: Contour line is the imaginary line joining places of equal:
fields.explanation: A contour line is an imaginary line on a map joining points of equal elevation above a given level, typically sea level.

fields.question: Match the following
fields.explanation: Schedule X was added by 52nd amendment in 1985. It contains provisions of disqualification on the grounds of defection. Schedule Vlll contains List of 22 languages of India recognized by Constitution. Schedule l deals with the List of States & Union Territories. Schedule X Contains acts & orders related to land tenure, land tax, railways, and industries. Added by Ist amendment in 1951. Laws under Schedule IX are beyond the purview of judicial review even though they violate fundamental rights enshrined under part III of the Constitution.

fields.question: Match the following
fields.explanation: Constitution of India is unique in itself. fields.question: Which is the first state in India to enact the Food Security Act?
fields.explanation: The Chhattisgarh Assembly, in December 2012, enacted a landmark legislation by unanimously passing the Food Security Act, becoming the first state in the country to introduce such a law. The Act makes food entitlements a right and its non-compliance has been made an offence.

fields.question: The first shore-based integrated steel plant in the country is
fields.explanation: Visakhapatnam Steel Plant (VSP) is the first shore-based integrated steel plant Public sector in the country located at Visakhapatnam in Andhra Pradesh. The plant was commissioned in August 1992 with a capacity to produce 3 million tonnes per annum (MTPA) of liquid steel. The plant has been built to match international standards with state-of-the-art technology, incorporating extensive energy saving and pollution control measures. VSP has an excellent layout capable of expanding up to 16 MTPA.

fields.question: Name the condition which influences the development of plants into distinctive forms.

fields.question: According to the Geo-scientists, the shape of the earth is:

2. spherical
